links.title: GNU Bash
links.description: is an sh-compatible shell that incorporates useful features from the Korn shell and C shell.

links.title: Zsh
links.description: is a shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language.

links.title: tclsh
links.description: is a very powerful cross-platform shell, suitable for a huge range of uses.

links.title: bash-it
links.description: is a framework for using, developing and maintaining shell scripts and custom commands.

links.title: Oh My ZSH!
links.description: is the best framework for managing your Zsh configuration.

links.title: Oh My Fish
links.description: the Fishshell framework.

links.title: Starship
links.description: the cross-shell prompt written in Rust.

links.title: powerlevel10k
links.description: is a fast reimplementation of Powerlevel9k ZSH theme.

links.title: z
links.description: tracks the folder you use the most and allow you to jump, without having to type the whole path.

links.title: fzf
links.description: is a general-purpose command-line fuzzy finder.

links.title: zsh-autosuggestions
links.description: Fish-like autosuggestions for Zsh.

links.title: zsh-syntax-highlighting
links.description: Fish shell like syntax highlighting for Zsh.

links.title: Awesome ZSH Plugins
links.description: A list of frameworks, plugins, themes and tutorials for ZSH.

links.title: Midnight Commander
links.description: is a visual file manager, licensed under GNU General Public License.

links.title: ranger
links.description: is a VIM-inspired filemanager for the console.

links.title: nnn
links.description: is a tiny, lightning fast, feature-packed file manager.

links.title: screen
links.description: is a full-screen window manager that multiplexes a physical terminal.

links.title: tmux
links.description: is a terminal multiplexer, lets you switch easily between several programs in one terminal.

links.title: tmux-cssh
links.description: is a tool to set comfortable and easy to use functionality tmux-sessions.

links.title: vi
links.description: is one of the most common text editors on Unix.

links.title: vim
links.description: is a highly configurable text editor.

links.title: emacs
links.description: is an extensible, customizable, free/libre text editor, and more.

links.title: micro
links.description: is a modern and intuitive terminal-based text editor.

links.title: neovim
links.description: is a free open source, powerful, extensible and usable code editor.

links.title: spacemacs
links.description: a community-driven Emacs distribution.

links.title: spacevim
links.description: a community-driven vim distribution.

links.title: fd
links.description: is a simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to find.

links.title: ncdu
links.description: is an easy to use, fast disk usage analyzer.

links.title: PuTTY
links.description: is an SSH and telnet client, developed originally by Simon Tatham.

links.title: Mosh
links.description: is a SSH wrapper designed to keep a SSH session alive over a volatile connection.

links.title: Eternal Terminal
links.description: enables mouse-scrolling and tmux commands inside the SSH session.

links.title: nmap
links.description: is a free and open source (license) utility for network discovery and security auditing.

links.title: zmap
links.description: is a fast single packet network scanner designed for Internet-wide network surveys.

links.title: Rust Scan
links.description: to find all open ports faster than Nmap.

links.title: masscan
links.description: is the fastest Internet port scanner, spews SYN packets asynchronously.

links.title: pbscan
links.description: is a faster and more efficient stateless SYN scanner and banner grabber.

links.title: hping
links.description: is a command-line oriented TCP/IP packet assembler/analyzer.

links.title: mtr
links.description: is a tool that combines the functionality of the 'traceroute' and 'ping' programs in a single tool.

links.title: mylg
links.description: utility which combines the functions of the different network probes in one diagnostic tool.

links.title: netcat
links.description: utility which reads and writes data across network connections, using the TCP/IP protocol.

links.title: socat
links.description: utility which transfers data between two objects.

links.title: tcpdump
links.description: is a powerful command-line packet analyzer.

links.title: tshark
links.description: is a tool that allows us to dump and analyze network traffic (wireshark cli).

links.title: Termshark
links.description: is a simple terminal user-interface for tshark.

links.title: ngrep
links.description: is like GNU grep applied to the network layer.

links.title: netsniff-ng
links.description: is a Swiss army knife for your daily Linux network plumbing if you will.

links.title: sockdump
links.description: dump unix domain socket traffic.

links.title: stenographer
links.description: is a packet capture solution which aims to quickly spool all packets to disk.

links.title: tcpterm
links.description: visualize packets in TUI.

links.title: bmon
links.description: is a monitoring and debugging tool to capture networking related statistics and prepare them visually.

links.title: iptraf-ng
links.description: is a console-based network monitoring program for Linux that displays information about IP traffic.

links.title: vnstat
links.description: is a network traffic monitor for Linux and BSD.

links.title: iPerf3
links.description: is a tool for active measurements of the maximum achievable bandwidth on IP networks.

links.title: ethr
links.description: is a Network Performance Measurement Tool for TCP, UDP & HTTP.

links.title: Etherate
links.description: is a Linux CLI based Ethernet and MPLS traffic testing tool.

links.title: echoip
links.description: is a IP address lookup service.

links.title: Nemesis
links.description: packet manipulation CLI tool; craft and inject packets of several protocols.

links.title: packetfu
links.description: a mid-level packet manipulation library for Ruby.

links.title: Scapy
links.description: packet manipulation library; forge, send, decode, capture packets of a wide number of protocols.

links.title: impacket
links.description: is a collection of Python classes for working with network protocols.

links.title: ssh-audit
links.description: is a tool for SSH server auditing.

links.title: aria2
links.description: is a lightweight multi-protocol & multi-source command-line download utility.

links.title: iptables-tracer
links.description: observe the path of packets through the iptables chains.

links.title: inception
links.description: a highly configurable tool to check for whatever you like against any number of hosts.

links.title: mRemoteNG
links.description: a fork of mRemote, multi-tabbed PuTTy on steroids!

links.title: dnsdiag
links.description: is a DNS diagnostics and performance measurement tools.

links.title: fierce
links.description: is a DNS reconnaissance tool for locating non-contiguous IP space.

links.title: subfinder
links.description: is a subdomain discovery tool that discovers valid subdomains for websites.

links.title: sublist3r
links.description: is a fast subdomains enumeration tool for penetration testers.

links.title: amass
links.description: is tool that obtains subdomain names by scraping data sources, crawling web archives, and more.

links.title: namebench
links.description: provides personalized DNS server recommendations based on your browsing history.

links.title: massdns
links.description: is a high-performance DNS stub resolver for bulk lookups and reconnaissance.

links.title: knock
links.description: is a tool to enumerate subdomains on a target domain through a wordlist.

links.title: dnsperf
links.description: DNS performance testing tools.

links.title: dnscrypt-proxy 2
links.description: a flexible DNS proxy, with support for encrypted DNS protocols.

links.title: dnsdbq
links.description: API client providing access to passive DNS database systems.

links.title: grimd
links.description: fast dns proxy, built to black-hole internet advertisements and malware servers.

links.title: dnstwist
links.description: detect typosquatters, phishing attacks, fraud, and brand impersonation.

links.title: curl
links.description: is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URLs.

links.title: kurly
links.description: is an alternative to the widely popular curl program, written in Golang.

links.title: HTTPie
links.description: is an user-friendly HTTP client.

links.title: wuzz
links.description: is an interactive cli tool for HTTP inspection.

links.title: h2spec
links.description: is a conformance testing tool for HTTP/2 implementation.

links.title: h2t
links.description: is a simple tool to help sysadmins to hardening their websites.

links.title: htrace.sh
links.description: is a simple Swiss Army knife for http/https troubleshooting and profiling.

links.title: httpstat
links.description: is a tool that visualizes curl statistics in a way of beauty and clarity.

links.title: httplab
links.description: is an interactive web server.

links.title: Lynx
links.description: is a text browser for the World Wide Web.

links.title: Browsh
links.description: is a fully interactive, real-time, and modern text-based browser.

links.title: HeadlessBrowsers
links.description: a list of (almost) all headless web browsers in existence.

links.title: ab
links.description: is a single-threaded command line tool for measuring the performance of HTTP web servers.

links.title: siege
links.description: is an http load testing and benchmarking utility.

links.title: wrk
links.description: is a modern HTTP benchmarking tool capable of generating significant load.

links.title: wrk2
links.description: is a constant throughput, correct latency recording variant of wrk.

links.title: vegeta
links.description: is a constant throughput, correct latency recording variant of wrk.

links.title: bombardier
links.description: is a fast cross-platform HTTP benchmarking tool written in Go.

links.title: gobench
links.description: http/https load testing and benchmarking tool.

links.title: hey
links.description: HTTP load generator, ApacheBench (ab) replacement, formerly known as rakyll/boom.

links.title: boom
links.description: is a script you can use to quickly smoke-test your web app deployment.

links.title: SlowHTTPTest
links.description: is a tool that simulates some Application Layer Denial of Service attacks by prolonging HTTP.

links.title: gobuster
links.description: is a free and open source directory/file & DNS busting tool written in Go.

links.title: ssllabs-scan
links.description: command-line reference-implementation client for SSL Labs APIs.

links.title: http-observatory
links.description: Mozilla HTTP Observatory cli version.

links.title: Hurl
links.description: is a command line tool to run and test HTTP requests with plain text.

links.title: openssl

links.title: gnutls-cli
links.description: client program to set up a TLS connection to some other computer.

links.title: sslscan
links.description: tests SSL/TLS enabled services to discover supported cipher suites.

links.title: testssl.sh
links.description: testing TLS/SSL encryption anywhere on any port.

links.title: cipherscan
links.description: a very simple way to find out which SSL ciphersuites are supported by a target.

links.title: spiped
links.description: is a utility for creating symmetrically encrypted and authenticated pipes between socket addresses.

links.title: Certbot
links.description: is EFF's tool to obtain certs from Let's Encrypt and (optionally) auto-enable HTTPS on your server.

links.description: simple zero-config tool to make locally trusted development certificates with any names you'd like.

links.title: certstrap
links.description: tools to bootstrap CAs, certificate requests, and signed certificates.

links.title: Sublert
links.description: is a security and reconnaissance tool to automatically monitor new subdomains.

links.title: mkchain
links.description: open source tool to help you build a valid SSL certificate chain.

links.title: ssl-cert-check

links.title: AppArmor
links.description: proactively protects the operating system and applications from external or internal threats.

links.title: grapheneX

links.description: Security + DevOps: Automatic Server Hardening.

links.title: ossec

links.title: auditd

links.title: Tiger
links.description: is a security tool that can be use both as a security audit and intrusion detection system.

links.title: Lynis
links.description: battle-tested security tool for systems running Linux, macOS, or Unix-based operating system.

links.title: LinEnum

links.title: Rkhunter

links.title: PE-sieve

links.title: PEASS

links.title: strace
links.description: diagnostic, debugging and instructional userspace utility for Linux.

links.title: DTrace
links.description: is a performance analysis and troubleshooting tool.

links.title: ltrace
links.description: is a library call tracer, used to trace calls made by programs to library functions.

links.title: ptrace-burrito
links.description: is a friendly wrapper around ptrace.

links.title: perf-tools
links.description: performance analysis tools based on Linux perf_events (aka perf) and ftrace.

links.title: bpftrace

links.title: Valgrind

links.title: gperftools
links.description: high-performance multi-threaded malloc() implementation, plus some performance analysis tools.

links.title: glances

links.title: bashtop

links.title: nmon
